message_1: A radioactive element has a half-life of 20 days. If the initial mass of the element is 100 grams, what will be the amount of the element after 60 days?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we can use the formula for radioactive decay:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 100 grams, the half-life is 20 days, and the time elapsed is 60 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 100 * (1/2)^(60 / 20)

Final mass = 100 * (1/2)^3

Final mass = 100 * (1/8)

Final mass = 12.5 grams

So, after 60 days, there will be 12.5 grams of the radioactive element remaining.
